results.title: Hand of Adam
results.creator_credit: Murray Grigor, Films of Scotland and Viz Ltd
results.brief_description: Shows the work of Robert Adam, the Scottish architect of the 18th century. His designs were mostly inspired by Ancient Rome and Greece, having studied these styles in Italy. Many examples of his fine work are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Murray Grigor, Films of Scotland and Viz Ltd

results.title: Hamster from Hamsterdam
results.creator_credit: W. Reiner, Z Drakulic and ACI Films
results.brief_description: An animated film using three-dimensional objects for the characters. A song tells the story of the hamster searching for a pair of gloves to keep his hands warm. Designed to encourage story telling and rhyme making by children.

results.title: Hamlet studies in interpretation
results.creator_credit: Richard Callanan and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This film shows two scenes from Hamlet, the Ophelia-Hamlet scene and the closet scene. The film demonstrates how different interpretation of the scenes by directors and actors may alter the impressions conveyed to the audience. Scenes are performed by Elizabeth Spriggs and Tom Chadbon.

results.title: Hamlet (Olivier)
results.brief_description: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

results.description: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action. Technically the film makes use of a number of camera devices, particularly the travelling camera. The characterization does not depart from the traditional.

results.title: Hamersley 70
results.brief_description: A Survey of the Hamersley Range iron mining operations. Includes scenes of the excavation of the ore from Mount Tom Price, the 182 mile railway to Dampier - the port from which iron pellets are exported all over the world.
results.description: A Survey of the Hamersley Range iron mining operations. Includes scenes of the excavation of the ore from Mount Tom Price, the 182 mile railway to Dampier - the port from which iron pellets are exported all over the world.

results.title: Hamersley '66
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the construction of an iron ore mine at Mount Tom Price in the Hamersley Range of Western Australia. In 1962 enormous high grade ore deposits were discovered, Hamersley Iron was contracted to supply ore to Japan in 1966. The silence of the arid red land was shattered by immense pieces of machinery feverishly working to meet the deadline.

results.title: Hallmarking
results.creator_credit: Andrew Holmes, Jack Holmes, Goldsmith's Company of London and Kenneth Myer Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of hall-marking and the evolution of different marks. Hall-marks represent a guarantee of quality and are based on stringent tests. Shows modern gold and silverware being tested at the London Assay Office. The different stages in the analysis are seen in detail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Holmes, Jack Holmes, Goldsmith’s Company of London and Kenneth Myer Productions

results.title: Instrumental program
results.creator_credit: F Whitman Trecartin, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Halifax Music”.
Displays some of the talents developed by students within the Halifax School Music Department system. From choral groups to jazz bands these youngsters have fun with their music and in so doing seem to involve their audiences in that enjoyment.

results.title: General music program
results.creator_credit: F Whitman Trecartin, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Halifax Music”.
Halifax Music is a documentary on the teaching methods of the Music Department of the Halifax School Board. Many of the basic concepts originated with the Hungarian composer Kodaly. Musical education is continuous from the primary grades through to Grade XII. The film tours the various classrooms, demonstrating methods and results, and shows how learning and enjoyment go hand in hand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F Whitman Trecartin, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
